summaryText: In this powerful sermon, Pastor Travis Hearn dives deep into Joshua chapter 1, teaching us how to position ourselves to receive God's blessing. Isn't it amazing how God is always ready to bless us, but we need to be 'blessable'? PT breaks down four key ways to prepare our hearts: stop dwelling in the past, remember God is always with you, be strong and courageous, and meditate on God's word day and night. Can you imagine how transformative life would be if we truly embraced these principles? Pastor Travis reminds us that God's blessing isn't just about material things, but about His incredible, life-changing presence. He challenges us to stop looking backward and start moving forward, to trust that God will be with us 'wherever we go'. The most powerful moment? When he emphasizes that God will never leave or forsake us, even when everyone else might. This sermon is a powerful reminder that God has a promised land for each of us, and He's waiting for us to get ready to step into it!
mainPoints: Remember God is always with you

versesMentioned.text: After the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses' aide: 'Moses my servant is dead. Now then, you and all these people, get ready to cross the Jordan River into the land I am about to give to the Israelites.'
Be strong and courageous, for you must go with this people into the land that the Lord swore to their ancestors to give them, and you must divide it among them as their inheritance.
Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.

Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength. These commandments that I give you today are to be on your hearts. Impress them on your children. Talk about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.
Jesus answered, 'It is written: Man shall not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.'

Monday.scripture: Joshua 1:9: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas where fear is holding you back
Monday.action: Make a list of three personal challenges you're afraid to tackle. Pray over each one, asking God for courage and strength.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me be strong and courageous. Where I am afraid, fill me with Your supernatural peace and confidence. Guide me to step forward in faith, knowing You are with me. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 43:19: 'See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.'
Tuesday.action: Reflect on past patterns that have held you back. Journal about one area where you're ready to let God do something new.
Tuesday.prayer: God, open my eyes to the new things You are doing. Help me let go of past limitations and embrace the fresh path You are creating. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13: 'Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead.'
Wednesday.action: Write down one past hurt or disappointment. Symbolically release it to God, focusing on moving forward.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, I surrender my past to You. Help me not be defined by my previous experiences, but by Your promises and future for me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Psalm 119:11: 'I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.'
Thursday.focus: Developing a consistent Scripture meditation practice
Thursday.action: Download a Bible app and set up a daily reading plan. Commit to reading at least one verse each day.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me treasure Your word. Give me a hunger to meditate on Your scriptures and allow them to transform my heart. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Deuteronomy 6:6-7: 'These commandments that I give you today are to be on your hearts. Impress them on your children. Talk about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road.'
Friday.focus: Integrating faith conversations into daily life
Friday.action: Have a purposeful conversation about faith with a family member or friend.
Friday.prayer: God, give me courage and wisdom to share Your love naturally. Help me be a light in my everyday conversations. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Joshua 1:8: 'Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then you will be prosperous and successful.'
Saturday.focus: Aligning daily actions with biblical principles
Saturday.action: Review your week. Identify one area where you can more intentionally apply biblical wisdom.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, help me not just hear Your word, but truly live it. Transform my heart and actions to reflect Your teachings. Amen.
